result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Gonzales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J Gonzales

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court with Attorney Dominic Richards.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 and 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #1.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #2      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 30 days in the DCJ, with Huber, cs to count 3. 

-Stayed for 24 months probation cc to 19CM1741 and 21CM1461

COUNT #3      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 30 days in the DCJ, with Huber,  

-Stayed for 24 months probation cc to 19CM1741 and 21CM1461

CONDITIONS:
-No contact with: Jennifer N and Benjamin F
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2 and 3
-DA surcharge due on probation.
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation
  
-Days credit if revoked: Zero

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D.]
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on April 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today or prior to the conclusion of this case.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jennifer N or Benjamin F. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 17 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:57 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Dominic Richards.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Warrant vacated.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
